Convert values to z-scores/centiles in the WHO Child Growth Standards

Source: R/who_gs.R
who_gs_value2zscore.Rd

Convert values to z-scores/centiles in the WHO Child Growth Standards

Usage

who_gs_value2zscore(y, x, sex, acronym)

who_gs_wfa_value2zscore(weight_kg, age_days, sex)

who_gs_bfa_value2zscore(bmi, age_days, sex)

who_gs_lhfa_value2zscore(lenht_cm, age_days, sex)

who_gs_wfl_value2zscore(weight_kg, length_cm, sex)

who_gs_wfh_value2zscore(weight_kg, height_cm, sex)

who_gs_hcfa_value2zscore(headcirc_cm, age_days, sex)

who_gs_acfa_value2zscore(armcirc_cm, age_days, sex)

who_gs_ssfa_value2zscore(subscap_sf_mm, age_days, sex)

who_gs_tsfa_value2zscore(triceps_sf_mm, age_days, sex)

who_gs_value2centile(y, x, sex, acronym)

who_gs_wfa_value2centile(weight_kg, age_days, sex)

who_gs_bfa_value2centile(bmi, age_days, sex)

who_gs_lhfa_value2centile(lenht_cm, age_days, sex)

who_gs_wfl_value2centile(weight_kg, length_cm, sex)

who_gs_wfh_value2centile(weight_kg, height_cm, sex)

who_gs_hcfa_value2centile(headcirc_cm, age_days, sex)

who_gs_acfa_value2centile(armcirc_cm, age_days, sex)

who_gs_ssfa_value2centile(subscap_sf_mm, age_days, sex)

who_gs_tsfa_value2centile(triceps_sf_mm, age_days, sex)

Arguments

y

Numeric vector of length one or more with anthropometric measurement(s) to convert to centiles/z-scores. Units depend on which acronym(s) are in use.

x, age_days, length_cm, height_cm

Numeric vector of length one or more with x values. Elements in x or its standard-specific equivalents (age_days, length_cm, and height_cm) should have specific units and be between certain values depending on the standard in use (defined by acronym). These are:

  • Between 0 and 1856 days for "wfa", "bfa", "lhfa", and "hcfa".

  • Between 45 and 110 days for "wfl".

  • Between 65 and 120 days for "wfh".

  • Between 91 and 1856 days for "acfa", "ssfa", "tsfa".

By default, gigs will replace out-of-bounds elements in x with NA and warn you. This behaviour can be customised using the functions in gigs_options.

sex

Character vector of length one or more with sex(es), either "M" (male) or "F" (female). This argument is case-sensitive. By default, gigs will replace elements of sex which are not "M" or "F" with NA and warn you. This behaviour can be customised using the functions in gigs_options.

acronym

Character vector of length one or more denoting the WHO Child Growth standard(s) in use. Each element should be one of:

  • "wfa" (weight-for-age)

  • "bfa" (BMI-for-age)

  • "lhfa" (length/height-for-age)

  • "wfl" (weight-for-length)

  • "wfh" (weight-for-height)

  • "hcfa" (head circumference-for-age)

  • "acfa" (arm circumference-for-age)

  • "ssfa" (subscapular skinfold-for-age)

  • "tsfa" (triceps skinfold-for-age)

This argument is case-sensitive. By default, gigs will replace elements in acronym which are not one of the above values with NA and warn you. This behaviour can be customised using the functions in gigs_options. If all elements in acronym are not one of the above values, gigs will throw an error.

weight_kg

Numeric vector of length one or more with weight measurement(s) in kg.

bmi

Numeric vector of length one or more with body mass index measurement(s) in kg/m2.

lenht_cm

Numeric vector of length one or more with length/height measurement(s) in cm.

headcirc_cm

Numeric vector of length one or more with head circumference measurement(s) in cm.

armcirc_cm

Numeric vector of length one or more with arm circumference measurement(s) in cm.

subscap_sf_mm

Numeric vector of length one or more with subscapular skinfold measurement(s) in mm.

triceps_sf_mm

Numeric vector of length one or more with triceps skinfold measurement(s) in mm.

Value

Numeric vector of z-scores/centiles with length equal to the longest input vector.

Note

Input vectors are recycled by vctrs::vec_recycle_common(), and must adhere to the vctrs recycling rules.

References

de Onis M, Garza C, Victora CG, Onyango AW, Frongillo EA, Martines J. The WHO Multicentre Growth Reference Study: planning, study design, and methodology Food Nutr Bull. 2004, 25(1 Suppl):S15-26. doi:10.1177/15648265040251s104

World Health Organisation. WHO child growth standards: length/height-for-age, weight-for-age, weight-for-length, weight-for-height and body mass index-for-age: methods and development. Technical report, WHO, Geneva, 2006.

World Health Organisation. WHO child growth standards: head circumference-for-age, arm circumference-for-age, triceps skinfold-for-age and subscapular skinfold-for-age: methods and development. Technical report, WHO, Geneva, 2007.

Cole TJ. The LMS method for constructing normalized growth standards Eur J Clin Nutr. 1990, 44(1):45-60. PMID: 2354692

Examples

# Convert values to centiles
who_gs_value2centile(y = c(10.1, 10.2, 10.3),
                     x = 504:506,
                     sex = c("M", "F", "M"),
                     acronym = "wfa") |>
  round(digits = 2)
#> [1] 0.32 0.58 0.38

# Or values to z-scores
who_gs_value2zscore(y = c(10.1, 10.2, 10.3),
                    x = 504:506,
                    sex = c("M", "F", "M"),
                    acronym = "wfa") |>
  round(digits = 2)
#> [1] -0.47  0.21 -0.31

# Specify which standard to use with the acronym parameter...
who_gs_value2centile(y = c(73.9, 67.9, 71.4),
                     x = 299:301,
                     sex = c("M", "F", "M"),
                     acronym = "lhfa") |>
  round(digits = 2)
#> [1] 0.64 0.08 0.22

# ... or by using a standard-specific function
who_gs_lhfa_value2centile(lenht_cm = c(73.9, 67.9, 71.4),
                          age_days = 299:301,
                          sex = c("M", "F", "M")) |>
  round(digits = 2)
#> [1] 0.64 0.08 0.22

# Inputs are recycled to the input of the longest length
who_gs_ssfa_value2centile(subscap_sf_mm = 6.1,
                          age_days = seq(450, 650, by = 50),
                          sex = "M") |>
  round(digits = 2)
#> [1] 0.44 0.47 0.50 0.52 0.54

# Bad inputs will not stop the function but will instead produce `NA`s in the
# output - by default gigs will issue useful warnings
who_gs_wfh_value2zscore(weight_kg = c(7.4, 14.2, 21.8, 22.4),
                        height_cm = c(65, 95, 120, NA),
                        sex = c("M", "M", "F", NA)) |>
    round(digits = 2)
#> Warning: Variable 'height_cm': 1 in 4 elements were missing (`NA`).
#> Warning: Variable 'sex': 1 in 4 elements were missing (`NA`).
#> [1] -0.05  0.12 -0.47    NA
